definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: , mng. dub.; either gnat, gnats, gnat-swarm (so LXX Vulgate Philo:Vita Mos. i, p. 97, Origen:Hom. Ex 4:6 in Ex., and most moderns), or [louse,] lice (so SyrVer Targum Jos:Ant. ii. 14. 13 Boch:Hieroz. II, ii, 572 f., as NH [[כִּנׇּה]], pl. [[כִּנִּים]] = maggots, and esp. lice)—abs. perh. [[כֵּן]] Is 51:6 (v. infr.); pl. [[כִּנִּים]] Ex 8:13, Ex 8:14, Ps 105:31, [[כִּנִּם]] Ex 8:12, Ex 8:13, Ex 8:14 has, also, [[כִּנׇּם]] prob. a mere Mas. device for [[כִּנִּם]] (cf. Di), on account of preceding [[וַתְּהִי]] (on which see Ges:§ 145. 4 Da:Synt. § 116); Sam. has [[כנים]] throughout:—of Egyptian plague Ex 8:12, Ex 8:13, Ex 8:13, Ex 8:14, Ex 8:14 (all P), hence Ps 105:31; [[כְּמוֹ־כֵן יְמוּתוּן]] Is 51:6 like a gnatswarm (?) shall they die (cf. Di Du; Weir Che rd. [[כנים]], cf. Buhl:p. 355; > Brd De like this).

definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: Note.—Nö:M 54 Ba:NB § 15, ES 53 Buhl:Ges HWB ed. 12 connect this word etymol. With Aram. [[כלמתא]] vermin, Ba and Buhl also with As. kalmatu, id. [Dl:HWB 333], and even with Aram. [[קלמתא]], qalmto0, Ar. qamlun, etc., Eth. q=umal: louse; but these connexions, as well as that with NH [[כְּנִימָה]], all involving radical [[מ]], are most improb.
